lines.text: Right. Now pay attention, 007. I want you to take great care of this equipment. There are one or two rather special accessories...
Q, have I ever let you down?
Frequently.
[last lines]
[Bond and Anya are discovered making love]
XXX!
Bond! What do you think you're doing?
lines.character: Sir Frederick Gray, Minister of Defence

lines.text: Keeping the British end up, sir.
Which bullet has my name on it? The first or the last?
I have never failed on a mission, Commander. Any mission.
In that case, Major, one of us is bound to end up gravely disappointed, because neither have I.
Moneypenny, where's 007?
He's on a mission sir. In Austria.
Well, tell him to pull out. Immediately.
[scene cuts to Bond making love to a woman]
[the motorcycle henchmen flies off a cliff in a cloud of feathers]
All those feathers and he still can't fly!
But James, I need you!
So does England!
He just dropped in for a quick bite.
Don't you miss the outside world?
For me, this is all the world. There is beauty... there is ugliness... and there is death.
Can I persuade you to accept a bed for the night?
[Claps his hands once]
That's kind of you Hoseim, but I really feel like -
[turns and notices a harem girl walking towards him]
Are you, eh, quite sure I can't persuade you to stay the night?
When one is in Egypt, one should delve deeply into its treasures.
Where is Fekkesh?
With the pharaohs.

[Amasova has just used a Bond car gadget to kill an enemy]
How did you know about that?
I stole the plans to this car two years ago.

[Sandor is barely holding onto Bond's necktie while dangling over the roof of a building]
Where's Fekkesh?
Pyramids!
[Bond knocks Sandor's hand away, he falls to his death]

[straightens his tie]
What a helpful chap.
I have a message for you.
I think you just delivered it.
The man I loved. He was in Austria 3 weeks ago. Did you kill him?

When someone's behind you on skis at 40 miles per hour trying to put a bullet in your back, you don't always have time to remember a face. In our business, Anya, people get killed. We both know that. So did he. It was either him or me. The answer to the question is yes. I did kill him.
Then, when this mission is over, I will kill you.
You don't have to worry about me, Mr. Bond. I went on a surviving course in Siberia.
Yes, I believe a great number of your countrymen do. What did they teach you?
That it's very important - to have a positive - mental - attitude.
Nothing more practical than that?
Food is also very important.
Mm-hmm. What else?
When necessary, shared - bodily - warmth.
That's the part I like.
[Kiss and embrace]
Your time is running out, Stromberg!
Yours too, Mr. Bond. Yours too. And faster than you think.
Oh, by the way, thanks for deserting me back there.
Every woman for herself, remember?
Still, you did save my life.
We all make mistakes, Mr. Bond.
What happened to Kalba?
He was cut off - permanently.
Then how about a nightcap on the company? My company.
I've been expecting you.
That armour plating must be inches thick. We'll never get through it!
Come on, let's go to the armoury.
The armoury? What do you expect to find there?
A nuclear missile!
Observe, Mr. Bond, the instruments of Armageddon.
[being endlessly pursued by Stromberg's villains]
You ever get the feeling that somebody doesn't like you?
Commander James Bond, recruited to the British Secret Service from the Royal Navy. License to kill and has done so on numerous occasions. Many lady friends but married only once. Wife killed...

[interrupts her]
Alright, you've made your point.
You're sensitive, Mr. Bond?
About some things.
Within minutes, New York and Moscow will cease to exist.
[Stromberg has just dropped his mistress from his elevator into a water tank, the sole occupant of which is a large tiger shark. The shark moves in]

[on loudspeaker]
It was you who betrayed me. You had access to all the information. Now you will pay the penalty.
[watches on a screen as the tiger shark moves in to the attack]
Yes, sir?
The lady will have a - Bacardi on the rocks.
For the gentleman, vodka martini - shaken, not stirred.
Touché.
Mmm, maybe I misjudged Stromberg. Any man who drinks Dom Perignon '52 can't be all bad.
Were they the two on the train?
[Jaws nods]
James Bond. And the woman is Major Amasova, a Russian agent. Let them get to shore... and then kill them.

Well gentlemen, now that the moment has come to bid you farewell, I congratulate both you, Doctor, and you, Professor, on your brilliant work in the development of the submarine tracking system. Thanks primarily to you, I am happy to say that the first phase of our operation has met with considerable success. I have instructed my assistant to have paid into your Swiss bank accounts the sum of ten million dollars each.
Thank you, sir.
Thank you indeed.

And that, I think, concludes our business. Before you go however, I very much regret to inform you that a dangerous development has recently been brought to my notice. Someone has been attempting to sell the plans of our tracking project to competing world powers; someone intimately associated with the project.
What can I offer you? Sheep's eyes? Dates? Vodka martini?
The printout transmission unit, can you work it?
Well sure, but James we've only got three minutes!
[first lines]
Captain wants to keep 500 feet.

[over PA]
Maneuvering, Control. Come in shallow to 500 feet.

[to crewman]
Keep 500 feet
Keep 500 feet, sir.

[in the Lotus Esprit, just before destroying one of Stromberg's helicopters with a missile]
It's time we said goodbye to an uninvited guest.
Mr. Kalba, my name is Bond, James Bond.
What of it?

[after detaining Jaws with a huge magnet]
How does that grab you?
Where's Anya?
Well, well... a British agent in love with a Russian agent. Détente, indeed.

[Bond, posing as a marine biologist, examines a model of Atlantis]
An underwater city. Well, everyone needs to have their dreams.
No dream, Mr. Sterling. Soon a reality.
[while making love]
But James, what will our superiors say?
They're never going to know.

[as James is removing the warhead to a nuclear missile]
James, are you sure you know what you're doing?
Well, there has to be a first time for everything.
Agent XXX. Calling Agent XXX. You will report to headquarters immediately. Agent XXX acknowledge and verify.
This is XXX. Message received and understood.
Mr. Fekkesh is expecting me. I phoned him.
He asked me to give you a message. He will be a little late.
May I ask where he is?
Mr. Fekkesh asked me to entertain you while you are waiting.
Oh, really?
Where is Fekkesh?
You are very suspicious, Mr. Bond.
Oh, I find I live much longer that way.
If there is anything that you would like? Anything at all?
Well, I had lunch; but, I seem to have missed dessert.
[Embrace and kiss]
What an unexpected pleasure. Welcome to the Mujaba Club. May I buy you a drink, Major Amasova - or may I call you XXX.
So, you know who I am.
You made quite an impression.
Goodbye, Mr. Bond.
Well, let's say "au revoir". I have the honest feeling we'll be meeting again sometime.
You have something I'm interested in buying.
Just a moment. I would like to bid for it too. You forgot your drink, Mr. Bond.
Thank you. Na zdorovje.
It seems you have competition, Mr. Bond. And from where I sit, I fancy you will find the lady's figure - hard to match.
Make no mistake, Mr. Bond, I *want* that microfilm and I'm going to get it.
Unless I get it first.
It's getting cold.
I say, anything I can do to warm you up?
You're not trying to take advantage of me, are you?

[Sarcastically]
The thought never crossed my mind.

[to Bond]
Our respective governments have agreed to pool our resources to find out what happened to our submarines.
We have entered a new era of Anglo-Soviet cooperation and as a sign of Russian good faith, I'm prepared to make available to you the microfilm recovered by Agent XXX.
With considerable ease, I might add.
I'm certain that two such perceptive talents will enjoy working together in Sardinia and that it will help to make Anglo-Soviet cooperation a reality.
Silly, isn't it. We can't talk and yet we're in the same business.
But with rival companies.
We're not rivals at the moment.
Why don't you lie down and let me look at it.
You have a reservation for me. The name is Sterling.
Ah, yes. Mr. and Mrs. Sterling, booked from Cairo.
That's right.
We have Suite A5 for you. A sitting room - and two bedrooms.

[to Anya]
Moneypenny being a little over efficient.
We don't make mistakes of that sort.
You sound just like a Russian.
I intend to change the face of history.
By destroying the world?
By creating a world - a new and beautiful world beneath the sea.
Today's civilization is known as corrupt, decedent. Inevitably, it will destroy itself. I'm merely - accelerating the process.
That does not justify mass murder.
For that, Major, I will accept the judgement of posterity.
In my country, Major, the condemned man is usually allowed a final request.
Granted.
Let's get out of these wet things.
[after structure falls on Jaws]
Egyptian builders.
[Anya trying to shift gears]
Can you play any other tune?
[a camera globe moves through the holding bay, examining the USS Wayne crew]

[to Anya]
Don't look up. You're on Candid Camera.
You're too late, Bond. The submarines are already on station. In four minutes, the missles will be launched.
Good morning 007.
Morning Q.
Mission successful?
On and off.
